the aim of this paper is to provide a classification of multilingual andplurilingual electronic lexicographic resources which would enable, one the onehand, the implementation of quantitative and qualitative criteria to produce atypological taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposedto platforms and websites and, on the other, the distinction of multilingualand plurilingual resources in terms of their larger or lesser prototypingdegree. in addition to offering a thorough description of the differentresources, this paper also puts forward some parameters and typologicalproposals to define and demarcate a number of electronic resources,particularly multilingual dictionaries and portals, while also outlining, andeven questioning, the object of study of multilingual and plurilinguallexicography. 
this paper aims at providing a comprehensive review of existing multilingualand plurilingual electronic lexicographic resources. the main objectives are toestablish a taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposedto platforms and websites, and to distinguish between multilingual andplurilingual resources according to their degree of prototyping. in addition toproviding a detailed description of the different resources, this paper alsoputs forward some parameters and typological proposals to define and demarcatea number of electronic resources, particularly multilingual dictionaries andportals, while also outlining, and even questioning, the object of study ofmultilingual and plurilingual lexicography.

This paper provides a comprehensive review of existing multilingual and plurilingual electronic lexicographic resources, focusing on the distinction of multilingual and plurilingual resources in terms of their larger or lesser prototyping degree. The main objectives are to establish a taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposed to platforms and websites, and to distinguish between multilingual and plurilingual resources according to their degree of prototyping. In addition to providing a detailed description of the different resources, this paper also puts forward some parameters and typological proposals to define and demarcate a number of electronic resources, particularly multilingual dictionaries and portals, while also outlining, and even questioning, the object of study of multilingual and plurilingual lexicography.
